lockoutpolicy_test.comment: Check that 'Reset account lockout counter after' is configured to '15' or greater
Check that 'Account lockout duration' is configured to '15' or greater
Check that 'Account lockout threshold' is configured to '6' or fewer

passwordpolicy_test.comment: Check that 'Maximum password age' is configured to '60' or less
Check that 'Enforce password history' is configured to '24'
Check that 'Store passwords using reversible encryption' is configured to 'Disabled'
Check that 'Minimum password age' is configured to '1'
Check that 'Password must meet complexity requirements' is configured to 'Enabled'
Check that 'Minimum password length' is configured to '14'

registry_test.comment: Check that 'Domain controller: Allow server operators to schedule tasks' is configured to 'Disabled'

user_sid55_test.comment: Check that 'Accounts: Guest account status' is configured to 'Disabled'

registry_test.comment: Check that 'Accounts: Limit local account use of blank passwords to console logon only' is configured to 'Enabled'
Check that 'Domain controller: Refuse machine account password changes' is configured to 'Disabled'

user_sid55_test.comment: Check that 'Accounts: Administrator account status' is configured to 'Disabled'

registry_test.comment: Check that 'System objects: Default owner for objects created by members of the Administrators group' is configured to 'Object creator'
Check that 'Network access: Shares that can be accessed anonymously' is configured to 'None'
Check that 'Interactive logon: Smart card removal behavior' is configured to 'Lock Workstation'

Check that 'Network security: Minimum session security for NTLM SSP based (including secure RPC) clients' is configured to 'Require message integrity,Require message confidentiality,Require NTLMv2 session security,Require 128-bit encryption&#3
Check that 'Devices: Prevent users from installing printer drivers' is configured to 'Enabled'
Check that 'Devices: Unsigned driver installation behavior' is configured to 'Warn but allow installation'
Check that 'Recovery console: Allow floppy copy and access to all drives and all folders' is configured to 'Disabled'
Check that 'MSS: (DisableSavePassword) Prevent the dial-up password from being saved (recommended)' is configured to 'Enabled'
Check that 'Network access: Restrict anonymous access to Named Pipes and Shares' is configured to 'Enabled'
Check that 'MSS: (WarningLevel) Percentage threshold for the security event log at which the system will generate a warning' is configured to '90'
Check that 'MSS: (SynAttackProtect) Syn attack protection level (protects against DoS)' is configured to 'Connections time out sooner if a SYN attack is detected'
Check that 'System settings: Use Certificate Rules on Windows Executables for Software Restriction Policies' is configured to 'Enabled'
Check that 'MSS: (AutoShareServer) Enable Administrative Shares (recommended except for highly secure environments)' is configured to 'Enabled'
Check that 'Shutdown: Clear virtual memory pagefile' is configured to 'Disabled'
Check that 'Domain member: Disable machine account password changes' is configured to 'Disabled'
Check that 'Microsoft network server: Amount of idle time required before suspending session' is configured to '15'
Check that 'MSS: (NoNameReleaseOnDemand) Allow the computer to ignore NetBIOS name release requests except from WINS servers' is configured to 'Enabled'
Check that 'MSS: (KeepAliveTime) How often keep-alive packets are sent in milliseconds' is configured to '300000 or 5 minutes (recommended)'
Check that 'Shutdown: Allow system to be shut down without having to log on' is configured to 'Disabled'
Check that 'Interactive logon: Do not display last user name' is configured to 'Enabled'
Check that 'Network security: LAN Manager authentication level' is configured to 'Send NTLMv2 response only. Refuse LM & NTLM'
Check that 'MSS: (AutoAdminLogon) Enable Automatic Logon (not recommended)' is configured to 'Disabled'

Check that 'Network security: Minimum session security for NTLM SSP based (including secure RPC) servers' is configured to 'Require message integrity,Require message confidentiality,Require NTLMv2 session security,Require 128-bit encryption&#3
Check that 'System objects: Require case insensitivity for non-Windows subsystems' is configured to 'Enabled'
Check that 'System settings: Optional subsystems' is configured to ''
Check that 'Devices: Allowed to format and eject removable media' is configured to 'Administrators'
Check that 'Microsoft network client: Digitally sign communications (always)' is configured to 'Enabled'
Check that 'Interactive logon: Prompt user to change password before expiration' is configured to '14'
Check that 'Domain member: Maximum machine account password age' is configured to '30'
Check that 'MSS: (SafeDllSearchMode) Enable Safe DLL search mode (recommended)' is configured to 'Enabled'
Check that 'MSS: (TcpMaxDataRetransmissions) How many times unacknowledged data is retransmitted (3 recommended, 5 is default)' is configured to '3'
Check that 'Domain member: Digitally sign secure channel data (when possible)' is configured to 'Enabled'
Check that 'Domain member: Digitally encrypt secure channel data (when possible)' is configured to 'Enabled'
Check that 'Microsoft network client: Send unencrypted password to third-party SMB servers' is configured to 'Disabled'
Check that 'Interactive logon: Do not require CTRL+ALT+DEL' is configured to 'Disabled'
Check that 'MSS: (ScreenSaverGracePeriod) The time in seconds before the screen saver grace period expires (0 recommended)' is configured to '0'
Check that 'Microsoft network client: Digitally sign communications (if server agrees)' is configured to 'Enabled'
Check that 'Domain member: Digitally encrypt or sign secure channel data (always)' is configured to 'Enabled'
Check that 'System objects: Strengthen default permissions of internal system objects (e.g. Symbolic Links)' is configured to 'Enabled'
Check that 'Network security: Do not store LAN Manager hash value on next password change' is configured to 'Enabled'

Check that 'Network access: Remotely accessible registry paths and sub-paths' is configured to 'System\CurrentControlSet\Control\Print\PrintersSystem\CurrentControlSet\Services\EventlogSoftware\Microsoft\OLAP ServerSoftware\Microsoft\Win
Check that 'MSS: (DisableIPSourceRouting) IP source routing protection level (protects against packet spoofing)' is configured to 'Highest protection, source routing is completely disabled'
Check that 'MSS: (PerformRouterDiscovery) Allow IRDP to detect and configure Default Gateway addresses (could lead to DoS)' is configured to 'Disabled'

Check that 'MSS: (TcpMaxConnectResponseRetransmissions) SYN-ACK retransmissions when a connection request is not acknowledged' is configured to '3 & 6 seconds, half-open connections dropped after 21 seconds'
Check that 'Microsoft network server: Disconnect clients when logon hours expire' is configured to 'Enabled'
Check that 'Network access: Let Everyone permissions apply to anonymous users' is configured to 'Disabled'
Check that 'Microsoft network server: Digitally sign communications (always)' is configured to 'Enabled'
Check that 'Network security: LDAP client signing requirements' is configured to 'Negotiate signing' or better
Check that 'Devices: Allow undock without having to log on' is configured to 'Disabled'
Check that 'Audit: Audit the access of global system objects' is configured to 'Disabled'
Check that 'MSS: (AutoReboot) Allow Windows to automatically restart after a system crash (recommended except for highly secure environments)' is configured to 'Enabled'
Check that 'Interactive logon: Require smart card' is configured to 'Disabled'

wmi57_test.comment: Check that 'Network access: Allow anonymous SID/Name translation' is configured to 'Disabled'

registry_test.comment: Check that 'Domain member: Require strong (Windows 2000 or later) session key' is configured to 'Enabled'

Check that 'Network access: Remotely accessible registry paths' is configured to 'System\CurrentControlSet\Control\ProductOptionsSystem\CurrentControlSet\Control\Server ApplicationsSoftware\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion'
Check that 'Interactive logon: Number of previous logons to cache (in case domain controller is not available)' is configured to '0'
Check that 'Network access: Do not allow anonymous enumeration of SAM accounts and shares' is configured to 'Enabled'
Check that 'Recovery console: Allow automatic administrative logon' is configured to 'Disabled'
Check that 'Audit: Shut down system immediately if unable to log security audits' is configured to 'Disabled'
Check that 'Microsoft network server: Digitally sign communications (if client agrees)' is configured to 'Enabled'
Check that 'Network access: Sharing and security model for local accounts' is configured to 'Classic - local users authenticate as themselves'
Check that 'Network access: Do not allow anonymous enumeration of SAM accounts' is configured to 'Enabled'
Check that 'Interactive logon: Require Domain Controller authentication to unlock workstation' is configured to 'Enabled'
Check that 'Network access: Do not allow storage of credentials or .NET Passports for network authentication' is configured to 'Enabled'
Check that 'MSS: (EnableDeadGWDetect) Allow automatic detection of dead network gateways (could lead to DoS)' is configured to 'Disabled'
Check that 'System cryptography: Use FIPS compliant algorithms for encryption, hashing, and signing' is configured to 'Disabled'
Check that 'Audit: Audit the use of Backup and Restore privilege' is configured to 'Disabled'
Check that 'MSS: (EnableICMPRedirect) Allow ICMP redirects to override OSPF generated routes' is configured to 'Disabled'
Check that 'MSS: (NoDefaultExempt) Configure IPSec exemptions for various types of network traffic.' is configured to 'Only ISAKMP is exempt (recommended for Windows Server 2003)'

auditeventpolicy_test.comment: Check that 'Audit directory service access' is configured to 'Failure'
Check that 'Audit account logon events' is configured to 'Success, Failure'
Check that 'Audit logon events' is configured to 'Success, Failure'
Check that 'Audit process tracking' is configured to 'No Auditing'
Check that 'Audit account management' is configured to 'Success, Failure'
Check that 'Audit policy change' is configured to 'Success'
Check that 'Audit policy change' is configured to 'Success and Failure'
Check that 'Audit system events' is configured to 'Success'
Check that 'Audit system events' is configured to 'Success'
Check that 'Audit privilege use' is configured to 'Failure'
Check that 'Audit privilege use' is configured to 'Failure'

accesstoken_test.comment: Check that 'Allow log on through Terminal Services' is configured to 'Administrators'
Check that 'Allow log on through Terminal Services' is configured to 'Administrators, Remote desktop Users'
Check that 'Take ownership of files or other objects' is configured to 'Administrators'
Check that 'Enable computer and user accounts to be trusted for delegation' is configured to 'Administrators'
Check that 'Remove computer from docking station' is configured to 'Administrators'
Check that 'Debug programs' is configured to 'Administrators'

Check that 'Replace a process level token' is configured to 'LOCAL SERVICE, NETWORK SERVICE'
Check that 'Profile system performance' is configured to 'Administrators'

Check that 'Create a pagefile' is configured to 'Administrators'
Check that 'Log on as a service' is configured to 'NETWORK SERVICE'
Check that 'Allow log on locally' is configured to 'Administrators'
Check that 'Manage auditing and security log' is configured to 'Administrators'
Check that 'Modify firmware environment values' is configured to 'Administrators'

userright_test.comment: Check that 'Deny log on as a batch job' is configured to 'Guests'
Check that 'Deny log on through Terminal Services' is configured to 'Guests'
Check that 'Deny access to this computer from the network' is configured to 'ANONYMOUS LOGON, Guests'

registry_test.comment: Check that 'Retention method for system log' is configured to 'Overwrites events as needed'
Check that 'Maximum application log size' is configured to '16384'
Check that 'Retention method for security log' is configured to 'Overwrites events as needed'
Check that 'Maximum system log size' is configured to '16384'
Check that 'Maximum security log size' is configured to '81920'
Check that 'Retention method for application log' is configured to 'Overwrites events as needed'
Check that 'Restrictions for Unauthenticated RPC clients' is configured to 'Enabled:Authenticated'
Check that 'Turn off Autoplay' is configured to 'Enabled'
Check that 'Always install with elevated privileges' is configured to 'Disabled'

wmi57_object.wql: SELECT Setting FROM RSOP_SecuritySettingBoolean WHERE KeyName='LSAAnonymousNameLookup'
